revised_title: The Role of Brain Localization in Motor and Sensory Functions
tldr: The author conducts experiments on various animals to investigate the localization of function in the brain. The study confirms that there is a localization of function in specific regions of the cerebral hemispheres, with centers for carrying out simple and complex muscular movements and sensory perception. The research provides a foundation for understanding the anatomical homology of the brain and the division of sensory and motor regions.
